apps.name: Bureau
apps.shortDescription: Office Suite: Spreadsheet, Document, and miniPaint
apps.description:
# Bureau Office Suite

Bureau is a multi-grain collaborative office suite for Sandstorm. It packages four distinct grain types — **Spreadsheet**, **Document**, **Diagram**, and **miniPaint** — each running as an isolated Sandstorm grain with its own data store, permissions, and real-time collaboration.

## Grain Types

### Spreadsheet
A full-featured collaborative spreadsheet with real-time multi-user editing via WebSocket. Supports cell styling, merged cells, comments, column/row operations, search, pagination, CSV/JSON/XLSX import and export, undo/redo, and named version snapshots you can browse and restore.

### Document
A rich-text document editor built on TipTap and Yjs CRDT, providing conflict-free real-time collaborative editing. Supports bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, headings (H1–H3), bullet and ordered lists, blockquotes, code blocks, horizontal rules, and tables. Includes named version snapshots with restore.

### Diagram
A collaborative diagramming tool for flowcharts, org charts, network diagrams, and freeform drawings. Supports shapes, connectors, text labels, and export. Real-time sync and snapshot versioning included.

### miniPaint
An integrated image editor based on miniPaint. Supports layers, filters (blur, sharpen, brightness, contrast, etc.), drawing tools, crop, resize, rotate, and export to PNG/JPG/BMP/WebP. Collaborative lock-based editing with snapshot versioning.

## Key Features

- **Live Collaboration**: All four grain types support real-time multi-user editing via WebSocket with presence indicators and user counts.
- **Snapshots**: Every grain type supports named version snapshots — save, browse, compare, and restore previous versions of your work at any time.
- **Sandstorm Permissions**: Four permission levels (Viewer, Commenter, Editor, Admin) enforced server-side via Sandstorm capability system.
- **Powerbox Integration**: Grains can link to each other via Sandstorm Powerbox for cross-grain references.
- **Offline-Ready**: Each grain stores data locally in SQLite and syncs when reconnected.
- **Export**: Spreadsheets export to CSV, JSON, XLSX. Documents export to HTML. Images export to PNG/JPG/BMP/WebP.

apps.name: Instasys Mail
apps.description:
Instasys Mail is a native email client for [Sandstorm](https://sandstorm.io), built with Go and HTMX. It connects directly to Sandstorm's Cap'n Proto APIs — no HTTP bridge required.

## Features

- **Inbox & Folders** — View, organise, and search your email across custom folders
- **Compose & Reply** — Rich compose form with reply, reply-all, and forward support
- **Attachments** — Upload, download, and inline-view attachments
- **Drafts** — Auto-save and manually save drafts; resume editing anytime
- **Search** — Full-text search across all messages
- **Star & Organise** — Star important messages, move between folders, bulk delete
- **Real-time Updates** — WebSocket push for new mail notifications
- **Role-based Access** — Sandstorm sharing with viewer, editor, and admin roles
- **Lightweight** — Single static binary, SQLite storage, zero external dependencies

## How It Works

Each Sandstorm grain is an independent mailbox. Email arrives via Sandstorm's built-in SMTP gateway and is stored locally in SQLite. The UI is server-rendered HTML with HTMX for seamless partial updates — no JavaScript framework required.

## Technical Details

- **Backend:** Go with native Cap'n Proto RPC (no sandstorm-http-bridge)
- **Frontend:** Server-side HTML + HTMX + WebSocket
- **Storage:** SQLite with automatic migrations
- **Binary:** Statically linked, runs inside the Sandstorm grain sandbox

apps.name: MiniGit
apps.shortDescription: Lightweight Git hosting with web viewer
apps.description:
A simple wrapper around git-http-backend and GitWeb, providing an extremely lightweight way to host
a web-browsable Git repository.

You can connect through your Git client to pull or push, and you can connect through your web browser
to search file contents and explore revision history.

You can also push to a special branch named `public` in order to publish its
static contents at a public Pearl URL.

apps.name: Shell Tester
apps.description:
# Shell Tester

A minimal Sandstorm grain for testing Melusina shell extensions.

## Features

- **Wallet Signing** — Test wallet signing operations via Melusina shell capabilities
- **OTP** — Verify one-time password generation and validation
- **NFTs** — Test NFT-related operations through shell extensions
- **Solana RPC** — Exercise Solana RPC calls via the Melusina shell interface

## Technical Details

Shell Tester uses raw Cap'n Proto communication (no HTTP bridge), connecting directly to Melusina shell extension capabilities. The UI is a single embedded HTML page served by a Go binary.

This grain is intended for developers and testers working on Melusina platform integrations.
